result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel P. White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:31am
INCLDUES 15CM1322, 15CM1332, and 15CF720
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty James Kurszewski

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to:
15CF720
Ct. 2 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
15CM1322
Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 >> D&RI
15CM1332
Ct. 2 Trespass to Land-Remain after notice >> D&RI
COURT grants above

OTR:10:35am
BOR: 10:36am

PLEA: 
15CF720
Ct. 1 Stalking >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 4 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> NO CONTEST
15CM1332
Ct. 1 Disorderly conduct >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM1332 Ct. 1 and 15CF720 Ct. 4- w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation, concurrently. Complete any assessment, treatment, or follow up as recommended by agent. Complete corrective thinking program. Fulfill all rules of guardianship. No contact with K.M. or G. K. or their property within 200 feet. Pay court costs and pay DNA surcharge.

COURT ORDERS: 15CF720 Ct. 1- COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND Ct. 1 to state disorderly conduct, plus court costs and DNA surcharge. 63 days jail credit given. 

Parties to set RH date on DEOJ with JA.

State requests that cash bond be converted to signature bond
COURT grants and modifies cash bond to signature bond

Bond continues

Adj: 10:56am

MINUTES AMENDED 10/21/15 at 4:20pm

to amend Bond to $500 cash
Includes 15CM1322, 15CM1332, 15CF720
for Discovery and Demand for Discovery and Inspection - includes 15CM1322 & 15CM1332

Pre-trial conference at 08-27-2015 09:20 am.
Final pre-trial at 09-10-2015 08:50 am.
Jury Trial at 10-08-2015 08:30 am.

INCLUDES 15CM1332 & 15CM1322 No contact with victim(s): Downtown Pawn, B.W., G.N. or property. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
